- Read today’s buying prices (selected):
  NVDA 189.60; AMD 168.675; GOOGL 245.15; CRWD 501.225; MSFT 517.64; AMZN 221.01; AVGO 347.61

- Market and fundamentals snapshot (searched):
  - NVDA: Strong Q2 FY26 revenue growth with Blackwell data center up 17% q/q; gross margins ~72% (source: NVIDIA IR).
  - Broadcom: Reported major custom AI accelerator/networking collaboration, underscoring secular AI demand (source: NextBigFuture summary).
  - AMD: Continued AI GPU momentum across benchmarks/models (AMD blog).
  - Alphabet: AI and ad momentum; antitrust overhang easing in some narratives (Seeking Alpha analysis).
  - Amazon/AWS: Continued AI services rollout (AWS blog).
  - Apple: iPhone 17 early sales up y/y in China and U.S. (Reuters).
  - Cybersecurity: PANW/CRWD among leaders; spending resilient (IBD coverage).

Executed trades today

- Bought NVDA 10 shares at 189.60
- Bought GOOGL 6 shares at 245.15
- Bought AMD 6 shares at 168.675
- Bought CRWD 1 share at 501.225

Rationale

- AI infrastructure cycle: NVDA and AMD provide core compute for generative AI; secular demand visibility from hyperscalers and enterprises. Broadcom’s custom accelerator news further validates the spend environment across AI infrastructure.
- Foundational platforms: GOOGL leverages AI across Search/Ads and Cloud; monetization continues while regulatory risk appears less acute than feared in some recent coverage.
- Cybersecurity: CRWD benefits from cloud-delivered endpoint/XDR leadership and durable enterprise security budgets.

Next steps and risk management

- Keep ~51% cash to add on volatility or after confirming macro prints and earnings cadence. Focus add-on candidates: MSFT, AMZN, AVGO, PANW.
- Monitor: Treasury yields, inflation prints, AI supply chain updates (HBM, networking), and Q3 earnings guides.
- Diversification: As we deploy cash, add balance across cloud (MSFT/AMZN), security (PANW), and semis (AVGO) to avoid concentration risk.
